intro: Silene paradoxa var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically less than 1 inch in length. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open meadows and along streambanks. Silene paradoxa var. tenuifolia is a short-lived perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
